infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov

Class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov1

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelCalculator, ChannelCalculatorCommon, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer

    public class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov1
extends MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov

    Computes the differential mutual information of two given multivariate sets of observations (implementing MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate), using Kraskov-Stoegbauer-Grassberger (KSG) estimation (see Kraskov et al., below), algorithm 1. Most of the functionality is defined by the parent class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, and expanded on in MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.

    References:

    • Kraskov, A., Stoegbauer, H., Grassberger, P., "Estimating mutual information", Physical Review E 69, (2004) 066138.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www), Ipek Ã–zdemir

    • Method Detail

      • partialComputeFromObservations

        protected double[] partialComputeFromObservations(int startTimePoint,
                                      int numTimePoints,
                                      boolean returnLocals)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        Protected method to be used internally for threaded implementations. This method implements the guts of each Kraskov algorithm, computing the number of nearest neighbours in each dimension for a sub-set of the data points. It is intended to be called by one thread to work on that specific sub-set of the data.

        The method returns:

        1. for average MIs (returnLocals == false), the relevant sums of digamma(n_x+1) and digamma(n_y+1) for a partial set of the observations
        2. for local MIs (returnLocals == true), the array of local MI values
        Specified by:
        partialComputeFromObservations in class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        Parameters:
        startTimePoint - start time for the partial set we examine
        numTimePoints - number of time points (including startTimePoint to examine)
        returnLocals - whether to return an array or local values, or else sums of these values
        Returns:
        an array of sum of digamma(n_x+1) and digamma(n_y+1), then sum of n_x and finally sum of n_y (these latter two are for debugging purposes).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • partialNeighbourCountFromObservations

        public int[][] partialNeighbourCountFromObservations(int startTimePoint,
                                            int numTimePoints)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Mirrors MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.partialComputePredictionErrorFromObservations(int, int, int, boolean) in implementing the guts of each Kraskov algorithm; however this is not intended to be used in a computation per se but for debugging purposes where the caller specifically wants to examine the neighbour counts for each data point (which is what is returned)
        Parameters:
        startTimePoint -
        numTimePoints -
        Returns:
        an array of arrays of neighbour counts for each sample (first index), where the array of neighbour counts is for variable 1 or x (index 0) then variable 2 or y (index 1)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
